member.name: T:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Address
member.summary:
Address of creditor or debtor.
You can either set street, house number, postal code and town (type structured address) or address line 1 and 2 (type combined address elements). The type is automatically set once any of these fields is set. Before setting the fields, the address type is undetermined. If fields of both types are set, the address type becomes conflicting. Name and country code must always be set unless all fields are empty.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Address.Type
member.summary:
Gets the address type.
The address type is automatically set by either setting street / house number or address line 1 and 2. Before setting the fields, the address type is Undetermined. If fields of both types are set, the address type becomes Conflicting.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name, either the first and last name of a natural person or the company name of a legal person.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Address.AddressLine1
member.summary:
Gets or sets the address line 1.
Address line 1 contains street name, house number or P.O. box.
Setting this field sets the address type to unless it's already , in which case it becomes .
This field is only used for combined elements addresses and is optional.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Address.AddressLine2
member.summary:
Gets or sets the address line 2.
Address line 2 contains postal code and town.
Setting this field sets the address type to unless it's already , in which case it becomes .
This field is only used for combined elements addresses. For this type, it's mandatory.

member.summary:

The street must be specified without house number.

This field is only used for structured addresses and is optional.

member.summary:

member.summary: Gets or sets the creditor address.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill.ReferenceType
member.summary: Gets or sets the ype of payment reference
member.para: The reference type is automatically set when the reference is set (derived from the reference). So there is usually no need to set it explicitly.
member.value: One of the constant values ReferenceTypeXxxRef

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill.UpdateReferenceType
member.summary: Updates the reference type by deriving it from the payment reference.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill.Reference
member.summary:
Gets or sets the creditor payment reference.
The reference is mandatory for QR IBANs, i.e. IBANs in the range CHxx30000xxxxxx through CHxx31999xxxxx. QR IBANs require a valid QR reference (numeric reference corresponding to the ISR reference format).
For non-QR IBANs, the reference is optional. If it is provided, it must be valid creditor reference according to ISO 11649 ("RFxxxx").
Both types of references may contain spaces for formatting.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill.CreateAndSetCreditorReference(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates and sets a ISO11649 creditor reference from a raw string by prefixing the string with "RF" and the modulo 97 checksum.
Whitespace is removed from the reference

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill.CreateAndSetQRReference(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates and sets a QR reference from a raw string by appending the checksum digit and prepending zeros to make it the correct length.
As the QR reference is numeric, the raw string must consist of digits and whitespace only. Whitespace is removed from the reference.
member.exception: rawReference contains non-numeric characters or is too long.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill.Debtor
member.summary:
Gets or sets the debtor address.
The debtor is optional. If it is omitted, both setting this field to null or setting an address with all null or empty values is ok.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill.RetrieveSwicoBillInformation
member.summary:
Retrieves the Swico structured bill information from the text in bill information property.
If contains Swico S1 bill information, the result is returned in a instance. Minor errors in the text are silently ignored. If does not contain Swico bill information or the text has major errors, null is returned.
member.returns: structured bill information (or null if no Swico bill information is found)
member.remarks: The bill information property likely contains structured bill information if it starts with //S1/.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.BillFormat.FontFamily
member.summary:
Gets or sets the font family to be used for text.
According to the implementation guidelines Arial, Frutiger, Helvetica and Liberation Sans are the only permitted fonts.
Two styles of the font are used: normal/regular and bold.
Defaults to Helvetica,Arial,"Liberation Sans".

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.BillFormat.Resolution
member.summary:
Gets or sets the resolution for pixel image graphics formats.
It is recommended to use at least 144 dpi for a readable result.
Defaults to 144 dpi.
member.value: The graphics resolution, in dpi (pixels per inch).

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.BillFormat.GraphicsFormat
member.summary:
Gets or sets the graphics format to be generated.
Defaults to .

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.BillFormat.MarginLeft
member.summary:
Gets or sets the left margin width (from edge of paper to start of text).
Valid values are between 5mm and 12mm. The default is 5mm.
Values other than 5mm are not fully standard compliant as the fields in the receipt on the left-hand side become narrower. It is especially obvious if Payable by or Amount are not pre-filled so that the black corners are printed instead of text. Yet values higher than 5mm are more compatible with typical office and home printers, which are not capable of printing up to the edge of the paper and require a margin wider than 5mm.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.BillFormat.MarginRight
member.summary:
Gets or sets the the right margin width (from the end of the text to the edge of the paper).
Valid values are between 5mm and 12mm. The default is 5mm.
Values other than 5mm are not fully standard compliant but are more compatible with typical office and home printers, which are not capable of printing up to the edge of the paper and require a margin wider than 5mm.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.BillFormat.LocalCountryCode
member.summary:
Gets or sets the local country code.
For postal addresses of the local country, the country code is omitted. For all other countries, the country is prepended to the postal code and town.
Defaults to "CH".

member.summary:
Formats text on a QR bill.
The resulting text often contains multiple lines, e.g. for addresses.These line breaks a represented by a line feed character(U+000A). Long lines might require additional line breaks to fit into the given text boxes.These additional line breaks are not included in the resulting text.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.FontMetrics.SplitLines(System.String,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Splits the text into lines.
The text is split such that no line is wider the specified maximum width. If possible, the text is split at whitespace characters. If a word is wider than the specified maximum width, the word is split and put onto two or more lines. The text is always split at newlines.
member.param: The text to split into lines.
member.returns: The resulting array of text lines.

member.summary:
Adds the specified text range to the resulting line array.
Trailing white space is trimmed.
member.param: The line array to add to.
The text serving as a source for the line.
The start position of the line within the text.
The end position (excluding) of the line within the text.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.FontMetrics.TextWidth(System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the width of the specified text for the specified font size.
member.param: The flag indicating if the text is in bold or regular weight.
member.returns: The text's width (in mm).

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.FontMetrics.CharWidth(System.Char)
member.summary:
Returns the width of the specified character.
The width is given in 0.001 pt for a font size of 1 pt. So to get the effective width in pt(1/72 in), it must be multiplied with the font size and divided by 1000.
The method only supports characters as defined in "Swiss Implementation Guidelines for Credit Transfer Initiation". For all other characters, a default width is returned.
member.returns: The width of the character.

member.name: T:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.ICanvas
member.summary:
Common interface for all output formats to draw the QR bill.
The coordinate system has its origin in the bottom left corner. The y-axis extends from the bottom to the top.
The graphics model is similar to the one used by PDF, in particular with regards to the orientation of the y axis, the concept of a current path, and using the baseline for positioning text.
Instance of this class are expected to use a single font family for the QR bill (regular and bold font weight).

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.ICanvas.ToByteArray
member.summary: Returns the result as a byte array.
member.returns: The result.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.ICanvas.SetTransformation(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary:
Sets a translation, rotation and scaling for the subsequent operations.
Before a new translation is applied, the coordinate system is reset to it's original state.
The transformations are applied in the order translation, rotation, scaling.
member.param: The translation in x direction (in mm).
The translation in y direction (in mm).
The scale factor in x direction (1.0 = no scaling).
The scale factor in y direction (1.0 = no scaling).

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.ICanvas.PutText(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Draws text to the canvas.
The text position refers to the left most point on the text's baseline.
member.param: The x position of the text's start (in mm).
The y position of the text's top (in mm).
Flag indicating if the text is in bold or regular weight.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.ICanvas.PutTextLines(System.String[],System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary:
Adds several lines of text to the graphics.
The text position refers to the left most point on the baseline of the first text line. Additional lines then follow below.
member.param: The x position of the text's start (in mm).
The y position of the text's top (in mm).
The amount of additional vertical space between text lines (in mm).

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.ICanvas.SplitLines(System.String,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Splits the text into lines.
The text is split such that no line is wider the specified maximum width. If possible, the text is split at whitespace characters. If a word is wider than the specified maximum width, the word is split and put onto two or more lines. The text is always split at newlines.
member.param: The text to split into lines.
member.returns: The resulting array of text lines.

member.name: T:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments
member.summary: Field validations related to Swiss Payment standards.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.CleanValue(System.String,Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.CleaningResult@)
member.summary:
Cleans a string value to make it viable for the Swiss Payment Standards 2018.
Unsupported characters(according to Swiss Payment Standards 2018, ch. 2.4.1 and appendix D) are replaced with spaces(unsupported whitespace) or dots (all other unsupported characters). Leading and trailing whitespace is removed.
If characters beyond 0xff are detected, the string is first normalized such that letters with umlauts or accents expressed with two code points are merged into a single code point(if possible), some of which might become valid.
If the resulting strings is all white space, null is returned.
member.param: The result to be filled with cleaned string and flag.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.IsValidIban(System.String)
member.summary:
Validates if the string is a valid IBAN number
The string is checked for valid characters, valid length and for a valid check digit. White space is ignored.
member.returns: true if the IBAN is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.IsQrIban(System.String)
member.summary:
Indicates if the string is a valid QR-IBAN.
QR-IBANs are IBANs with an institution ID in the range 30000 to 31999 and a country code for Switzerland or Liechtenstein. Thus, they must have the format "CH..30...", "CH..31...", "LI..30..." or "LI..31...".
member.returns: true for valid QR-IBANs, false otherwise

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.FormatIban(System.String)
member.summary:
Formats an IBAN or creditor reference by inserting spaces
Spaces are inserted to form groups of 4 letters/digits. If a group of less than 4 letters/digits is needed, it appears at the end.
member.param: The IBAN or creditor reference without spaces.
member.returns: The formatted IBAN or creditor reference.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.IsValidIso11649Reference(System.String)
member.summary:
Validates if the string is a valid ISO 11649 reference number
The string is checked for valid characters, valid length and a valid check digit. White space is ignored.
member.param: The ISO 11649 creditor reference to validate.
member.returns: true if the creditor reference is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.CreateIso11649Reference(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a ISO11649 creditor reference from a raw string by prefixing the string with "RF" and the modulo 97 checksum
Whitespace is removed from the reference.
member.returns: The created creditor reference.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.CalculateMod97(System.String)
member.summary:
Calculates the reference's modulo 97 checksum according to ISO11649 and IBAN standard.
The string may only contains digits, letters ('A' to 'Z' and 'a' to 'z', no accents). It must not contain white space.
member.returns: The calculated checksum (0 to 96).
member.exception: The reference contains an invalid character.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.IsValidQrReference(System.String)
member.summary:
Validates if the string is a valid QR reference.
A valid QR reference is a valid ISR reference.
The string is checked for valid characters, valid length and a valid check digit. White space is ignored.
member.param: The QR reference number to validate.
member.returns: true if the reference number is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.CreateQRReference(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates a QR reference from a raw string by appending the checksum digit and prepending zeros to make it the correct length.
Whitespace is removed from the reference.
member.param: The raw string (digits and whitespace only).
member.returns: The QR reference.
member.exception: The reference contains non-numeric characters or is too long

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Payments.FormatQrReferenceNumber(System.String)
member.summary:
Formats a QR reference number by inserting spaces.
Spaces are inserted to create groups of 5 digits. If a group of less than 5 digits is needed, it appears at the start of the formatted reference number.
member.param: The reference number without white space.
member.returns: the formatted reference number.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.QRBill.Validate(Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill)
member.summary:
Validates and cleans the bill data.
The validation result contains the error and warning messages (if any) and the cleaned bill data.
For details about the validation result, see Bill data validation
member.returns: The validation result.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.QRBill.Generate(Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill)
member.summary:
Generates a QR bill (payment part and receipt) or QR code as an SVG image or PDF document.
If the bill is not valid, a is thrown, containing the validation result. For details about the validation result, see Bill data validation
The graphics format is specified in bill.Format.GraphicsFormat.
member.returns: The generated QR bill (as a byte array in the specified graphics format).

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.QRBill.Draw(Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill,Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.ICanvas)
member.summary:
Draws the QR bill (payment part and receipt) or QR code for the specified bill data onto the specified canvas.
The QR bill or code are drawn at position (0, 0) extending to the top and to the right. Typically, the position (0, 0) is the bottom left corner of the canvas.
This methods ignores the formatting properties bill.Format.FontFamily and bill.Format.GraphicsFormat. They can be set when the canvas instance passed to this method is created.
If the bill data is not valid, a is thrown, containing the validation result. For details about the validation result, see Bill data validation.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.QRBill.DrawSeparators(Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SeparatorType,System.Boolean,Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Canvas.ICanvas)
member.summary:
Draws the separator line(s) to the specified canvas.
The separator lines are drawn assuming that the QR bill starts at position (0, 0) and extends the top and right.So position (0, 0) should be in the bottom left corner.
This method allows to add separator lines to an existing QR bill, e.g. on to an archived QR bill document.
member.param: true if both the horizontal and vertical line should be drawn, false for the vertical line only

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.QRBill.EncodeQrCodeText(Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill)
member.summary:
Encodes the QR bill data as a text to be embedded in a QR code.
The specified bill data is first validated and cleaned.
If the bill data is invalid, a is thrown, containing the validation result. For details about the validation result, see Bill data validation
member.returns: The text to embed in a QR code.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.QRBill.DecodeQrCodeText(System.String)
member.summary:
Decodes the text from a QR code and fills it into a data structure
A subset of the validations related to embedded QR code text is run. It the validation fails, a is thrown containing the validation result. See the error messages marked with a dagger in Bill data validation.
member.returns: The decoded bill data.
member.exception: If he text could not be decoded or the decoded bill data is invalid.

member.name: T:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation
member.summary:
Bill information (according to Swico S1) for automated processing of invoices.
Swico S1 (see http://swiss-qr-invoice.org/downloads/qr-bill-s1-syntax-de.pdf) is one of the supported standards for adding structured billing information to a QR bill (in the field StrdBkgInf).

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.InvoiceNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets the invoice number.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.InvoiceDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the invoice date.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.CustomerReference
member.summary: Gets or sets the customer reference.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.VatNumber
member.summary:
Gets or sets the invoicing party's VAT number.
The number without any prefix, white space, separator or suffix, i.e. "106017086" instead of "CHE-106.017.086 MWST".

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.VatDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the date when the goods or service were supplied.
member.remarks: If this property is non-null, and must not be used.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.VatStartDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the start date of the period when the service was supplied (e.g. a subscription).
member.remarks: If this property is non-null, must be set as well, and must not be used.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.VatEndDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the end date of the period when the service was supplied (e.g. a subscription).
member.remarks: If this property is non-null, must be set as well, and must not be used.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.VatRate
member.summary:
Gets or sets the VAT rate (in percent) in case the same rate applies to the entire invoice.
If different rates apply to invoice line items, this property is null and is used instead.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.VatRateDetails
member.summary:
Gets or sets a list of VAT rates.
Each element in the list is a tuple of VAT rate (in percent) and amount (in QR bill currency). It indicates that the specified VAT rate applies to the specified net amount (partial amount) of the invoice.
If a single VAT rate applies to the entire invoice, this list is null and is used instead.
member.example: If the list contained (8, 1000), (2.5, 51.8), (7.7, 250) for an invoice in CHF, a VAT rate of 8% would apply to CHF 1000.00, 2.5% for CHF 51.80 and 7.7% for CHF 250.00.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.VatImportTaxes
member.summary:
Gets or sets a list of VAT import taxes.
Each element in the list is a tuple of VAT rate (in percent) and VAT amount (in QR bill currency). It indicates that the specified VAT rate was applied and resulted in the specified tax amount.
member.example: If the list contained (7.7, 48.37), (2.5, 12.4) for an invoice in CHF, a VAT rate of 7.7% has been applied to a part of the items resulting in CHF 48.37 in tax and a rate of 2.5% has been applied to another part of the items resulting in CHF 12.40 in tax.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.PaymentConditions
member.summary:
Gets or sets the payment conditions.
Each element in the list is a tuple of a payment discount (in percent) and a deadline (in days from the invoice date).
member.example: If the list contained (2, 10), (0, 60), a discount of 2% applies if the payment is made by 10 days after invoice data. The payment is due 60 days after invoice date.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.SwicoBillInformation.DueDate
member.summary:
Gets the due date.
The due date is calculated from the invoice date and the payment condition with a discount of 0.

For valid field names and message keys, see the constants in the class.
member.param: The name of the affected field.
The optional variable text parts to be inserted into localized message.

member.name: T:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult
member.summary: The validation result, consisting of a list of validation messages and flags indicating the validation state.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult.ValidationMessages
member.summary:
Gets the list of validation messages.
The result is never null.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult.HasMessages
member.summary: Gets if this validation result contains any messages.
member.value: true if the result contains any messages, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult.HasWarnings
member.summary: Gets if this validation result contains any warning messages.
member.value: true if the result contains any warning messages, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult.HasErrors
member.summary: Gets if this validation result contains any error messages.
member.value: true if the result contains any error messages, false otherwise.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult.IsValid
member.summary:
Gets if the bill data is valid and the validation therefore has succeeded.
A successful validation may still produce warning messages.
member.value: true if the validation has succeeded, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult.AddMessage(Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationMessage.MessageType,System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Adds a new validation message to this validation result.
member.param: The name of the affected field.
The optional message parameters (text) to be inserted into the localized message.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult.CleanedBill
member.summary:
Gets or sets the cleaned bill data.
As part of the validation, the bill data is cleaned, i.e. leading and trailing whitespace is trimmed, empty values are replaced with null, invalid characters are replaced and too long data is truncated. The result is the cleaned bill data.

member.name: P:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.ValidationResult.Description
member.summary:
Gets a human-readable description of the validation problems.
The description includes errors only.

member.name: T:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Validator
member.summary: Internal class for validating and cleaning QR bill data.

member.name: M:Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Validator.Validate(Codecrete.SwissQRBill.Generator.Bill)
member.summary: Validates the QR bill data and returns the validation messages (if any) and the cleaned bill data.
member.returns: The validation result.
